content.text:
# New Features

## AI Model Integrations
- Added support for Mistral AI as a new model provider (#2137)
- Integrated DeepSeek AI provider (#2067)
- Added Heurist embedding model (#2093)
- Added Gemini to image vision capabilities (#2099)
- Added Cloudflare AI Gateway support (#821)

## Blockchain and Web3 Integrations
- Added Hyperliquid plugin (#2141)
- Implemented Lens Network Plugin for social interactions (#2101)
- Added Akash Network plugin with autonomous deployment capabilities (#2111)
- Added Irys plugin for decentralized storage (#1708)
- Implemented Primus zkTLS plugin to verify agent activities (#2086)
- Added Quai integration (#2083)
- Added Massa plugin for blockchain interactions (#1582)
- Made Solana transactions more lenient (#2053)
- Added support for autonome platform (#2121)

## Voice and Language Features
- Added Text-to-Speech (TTS) with support for over 15 languages (#2110)
- Added name and description to SttTtsPlugin (#2117)

## Documentation and Internationalization
- Added Verified Inference documentation (#2125)
- Added Portuguese version of README (#2088)
- Various documentation improvements (#2138)

## Other Features
- Added GitHub to client enumerations (#2157)
- Added pro API support and trending coins API (#2068)
- Implemented image descriptions in interaction.ts (#1775)
- Added conditionals for Supabase to agent directory (#2032)
- Added character inheritance using extends key (#2159)
- Implemented Asterai plugin (#2045)

# Bug Fixes

## Client and Plugin Issues
- Fixed syntax issue on autonome plugin and updated lock file (#2131)
- Prevented repeated login by reusing client-twitter session (#2129)
- Fixed Discord client join voice action (#2160)
- Fixed plugin loading from character.json file (#2095)
- Fixed clientConfig.telegram.isPartOfTeam mistype (#2103)
- Fixed Lens export name and duplicate imports (#2142)
- Fixed Starknet plugin by replacing walletProvider with portfolio provider (#2029)

## UI and Model Settings
- Applied model settings for images and removed duplicate files (#2118)
- Fixed SUI/USD price calculation (#2150)

## Code Quality
- Updated lockfile and fixed lint findings (#2128)
- Removed unused imports (#2112)
- Fixed package name in clients.md (#2091)
- Reverted "Proof of Pizza - Agentic Dominos Ordering" (#2075)
- Fixed eslint issues (#2143)
- Made Supabase updates (#2100)

# Testing and Refactoring

## Test Improvements
- Enhanced integration tests and added Coinbase Commerce integration (#1767)
- Added tests for Coinbase plugin (#2170)
- Moved UUID tests to correct __tests__ directory (#2168)
- Updated git command for checking latest release (#1705)
- Added UUID tests and fixed version 5 bits (#1362)

## Refactoring
- Optimized memory fetching by moving sorting and slicing to DB (#2135)
- Reverted #1808 and added missing import for CoinGecko plugin (#2106)

## Maintenance
- Bumped develop lockfile (#2166)

categories.title: GitHub Repository Analysis and Open Source Development

content.text: DankVR compares Eliza and BabyAGI GitHub repositories, highlighting the need for better tools to analyze GitHub repos beyond just star counts. Eliza shows more active development with recent commits, more issues/PRs, and real traction despite having half the stars of BabyAGI (10.9k vs 20k). Eliza has hundreds more contributors, 330x more commits, and is used in production.
DankVR highlights an Eliza plugin for Obsidian by XCodeCarlos that turns an Obsidian vault into an AI agent/portable second brain that people can interact with like a digital librarian.

DankVR discusses crypto as an industry built around incentive alignment engineering with tokens as primitives, and mentions work being done with agents to analyze contributions and assist with retroactive public goods funding.

Several issues have been reported in the ElizaOS GitHub repository, covering various aspects of the system:

1. Build and Installation Issues:
   - Issue #2127: Users are encountering an "ERR_PNPM_RECURSIVE_RUN_FIRST_FAIL" error
   - Issue #2164: Type compatibility problems with parameters 'url' and 'request' when making a fresh clone
   - Issue #2114: The @elizaos/plugin-twitter package has not been published to npm

2. Platform-Specific Issues:
   - Issue #2089: Double responses occurring when interacting on Telegram
   - Issue #2161: Replies to TWITTER_TARGET_USER are sent twice when ElizaOS is restarted
   - Issue #2155: Login attempt failures with specific error codes

3. Feature Requests and Improvements:
   - Issue #2109: Request for a response format feature
   - Issue #2126: Proposal to refactor and separate data providers into plugins
   - Issue #2169: Request to add tests for the Coinbase plugin according to package structure

4. Plugin-Related Issues:
   - Issue #2158: Database connection error when using the image generation plugin

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the Eliza Project

content.text: The Eliza project has seen significant development with multiple new features and plugins being added through recent pull requests. A major update is the addition of Text to Speech (TTS) functionality (PR #2108), which will enhance Eliza's communication capabilities. The project is also preparing for version 0.1.8 release with PR #2171 merging development changes into the main branch.

Several blockchain and web3 related plugins have been introduced, including Chainbase (PR #2162), NFT PRO (PR #2163), a general NFT plugin (PR #2167), CKB Fiber (PR #2084), and O1 integration (PR #1184). These additions significantly expand Eliza's capabilities in the blockchain and NFT space.

Communication capabilities have been enhanced with the Twilio plugin (PR #1665), enabling voice and text interactions. Additionally, the web search functionality has been improved by changing the plugin-web-search to use google.serper.dev (PR #2113), which should provide more reliable search results.

A notable addition is the Akash Network plugin (PR #2111), which brings autonomous deployment capabilities to Eliza. This will allow for more flexible and scalable deployments of applications built on the Eliza platform.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From January 10-11, 2025, there were 42 new pull requests with 21 merged, 12 new issues created, and 75 active contributors. The following day (January 11-12, 2025) saw 23 new pull requests with 27 merged, 7 new issues, and 65 active contributors. Overall, the project maintained strong development momentum with consistent contributor engagement across both days.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are, their contributions, or any statistics related to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the top contributors to the elizaOS/eliza project.
